resources.string: A microG/UnifiedNlp location provider backend using private on phone RF emitter database
Write all data to a CSV file
Use Kalman filter for GPS location
Recommended for devices with bad GPS
When disabled, scans for cell towers will not happen
When disabled, WiFi scans will not happen
Scans for emitters and displays result with additional information
Decide which emitters should be discarded in case of inconsistent locations

Default: only use the largest consistent group of emitters. This usually gives good accuracy, but occasionally produces wrong locations. Median: discard emitters that are unbelievably far from the median location: worse accuracy than default, but actual location is inside the accuracy circle more often. Use all emitters: sensitive to extreme outliers and often the least accurate of the three, but most likely to contain the actual location inside the accuracy circle. Often all 3 methods give (nearly) the same results, expect to see a difference only in some cases.
Select CSV created from export, Déjà Vu database or MLS export
How to handle emitters that already exist in local database?
